revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=July 2010}} {{Infobox University |name = University of Puerto Rico, Medical Sciences Campus |native_name = Universidad de Puerto Rico, Recinto de Ciencias Médicas |image_name = Seal of Recinto de Ciencas Medicas, UPR.svg |image_size = |caption = |latin_name = |motto = |tagline = |established = 1966 |closed = |vision = |type = [[Public university|Public]] |affiliation = |calendar = |endowment = [[United States Dollar|US $]]127.679 [[1000000 (number)|million]]<ref>http://www.elnuevodia.com/lasdeudasestrangulanacienciasmedicas-695788.html</ref> |debt = |rector = Noel J. Aymat Santana |officer_in_charge = |chairman = |chancellor = |president = |vice-president = |superintendent = |provost = |vice_chancellor = |principal = |dean = |director = |head_label = |head = |faculty = 623 |staff = |students = 2,766 |undergrad = 400 |postgrad = 2,366 |doctoral = |divinity = |residents = |other = |profess = |alumni = |city = [[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]] |state = |province = |country = [[Puerto Rico]] |address = |telephone = |coor = |campus = [[urban area|Urban]] |free_label = |free = |sports = |colors = |colours = |nickname = |mascot = |fightsong = |athletics = |affiliations = |nobel_laureates = |website = [http://www.rcm.upr.edu www.rcm.upr.edu] |logo = |publictransit = |footnotes = }} The '''University of Puerto Rico, Medical Sciences Campus''' —or '''Universidad de Puerto Rico, Recinto de Ciencias Médicas''' ('''UPRCM''') in [[Spanish language|Spanish]]— is a [[State university system|state university]] located in [[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]], [[Puerto Rico]]. It is one of the eleven campuses of the [[University of Puerto Rico]]. The Medical Sciences Campus is located on the grounds of the Puerto Rico Medical Center and grants degrees in all the principal fields of [[health sciences]]. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://acweb.upr.edu/vpit/about_folder/biomedical.pdf/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=October 25, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100610121152/http://acweb.upr.edu/vpit/about_folder/biomedical.pdf/ |archivedate=June 10, 2010 }}</ref>
==History== In 1966 the [[University of Puerto Rico]] organized the Medical Sciences Campus. [[Adán Nigaglioni Loyola]] was its first Rector in 1967.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://ihicis.rcm.upr.edu/?q=medicina| title=La Escuela de Medicina de la Universidad de Puerto Rico | publisher= Instituto de Historia de las Ciencias de la Salud (IHICIS,)UPR Recinto de Ciencias Médicas| language= Spanish | accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref> In 1972 the building was constructed in the grounds of the Rio Piedras Medical Center, which now blanket the [[UPR School of Medicine]], Specialized schools only in Puerto Rico and [[Pharmacy]] (1913), [[Dentistry]] (1957), Graduate School of [[Public Health]] (1970), College of Health Related Professions (1976) and the School of [[Nursing]] (1995). The enclosure also comprises three Deans who support: Dean of Administration, Student and Academic Affairs. They work together more than 2,000 employees (623 teachers and nonteaching 1,454) to approximately 2,766 full-time students. <ref>http://www.upr.edu</ref> <ref>http://www.rcm.upr.edu/rcm/</ref>
==Academics== The UPR-Medical Sciences Campus promotes education integrated with practice and experimentation, and offers multiple programs of study in the health field, including associate degrees, bachelor's degrees, post-baccalaureate certificates, master's, doctorate, residencies, post-doctoral degrees in: * [[Medicine]] * [[Dentistry]] * [[Pharmacy]] * [[Public Health]] * Biosocial Science * [[Environmental Health]] * [[Nursing]] * Physical and Occupational Therapy * [[Speech-Language Pathology]] * [[Nutrition]] * [[Demography]]
The School of Health Professions, offers 16 academic programs in specific disciplines such as Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Audiology, Clinical Laboratory Sciences, Speech Pathology, Health Information Administration and others which prepare students in specific disciplines within the field of health to exercise positions that complement care.
It also stresses, that provides services to the community at large through its clinics and research projects in partnership with international repercussions U.S. and international universities.
It is important to note that most of its programs, Medical Sciences Campus open only to students of second year onwards.
All programs offered by the Medical Sciences Campus, are accredited by the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools and the accrediting agency for the discipline.
===Professional schools===
* [[UPR School of Medicine]] * UPR School of Pharmacy * UPR School of Public Health * [[University of Puerto Rico School of Dental Medicine|UPR School of Dental Medicine]] * UPR Nursing School * UPR School of Health Professions
==Research== The Medical Sciences Campus is distinguished by outstanding academia in the field of the health professions. It is a multidisciplinary center, assuming the leadership in teaching and research on prevalent health conditions in Puerto Rico. The campus is a specialized center in basic, applied and clinical research in the [[biomedical sciences]]. It also includes the following research centers: the Puerto Rico Clinical and Translational Research Consortium, the Behavioral Research Institute, the Women’s and Health Research Center, the Research Center in Minority Institutions, the Maternal Infant Study Center, the Center for Clinical Research and Health Promotion, the UPR Cancer Center and the AIDS Clinical Trials Units. The Institute of Neurobiology is located in Old San Juan. The Caribbean Primate Center is located in SAbana Seca and also has a primate colony in an offshore island.
==Facilities==
===Conrado F. Asenjo Library===
The University of Puerto Rico Medical Sciences Campus Library is the main health sciences information resources on the Island and is considered to have the most complete collection of its kind in the Caribbean. Collection and services support academic programs in Medicine, Public Health, Dentistry, Nursing, Pharmacy and Allied Health. It is located in Unit C of the Central Building of the Campus, adjacent to the University Hospital and to the Medical Center Emergency Services. It has a total of {{convert|38044|sqft|m2}}, spread over five floors. Seating capacity is 410. The Library is open 108 hours per week. As a public university library and as a resource library under the National Network of Libraries of Medicine, the institution is committed to providing promoting use and access to information resources and databases among health professionals in the community, both individually and through affiliated institutions. * http://rcm-library.rcm.upr.edu Official Library Website
==Alumni Association== * Association of the University of Puerto Rico Alumni and Friends Abroad (UPRAA)<ref>https://upraa.org</ref>
==See also== {{Portal|Puerto Rico|Education}} *[[School of Tropical Medicine (Puerto Rico)|School of Tropical Medicine]] {{clr}}
==References== {{reflist}}
== External links == * {{Official website|http://www.rcm.upr.edu/rcm/Default.aspx}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2012}} '''William M. Baird''' was an American [[Presbyterian]] missionary who founded [[Soongsil University]] in Korea.
Baird was born in Indiana on June 16, 1862. He was educated at [[Hanover College]] (Bachelor's degree in 1885, PhD in 1903, and Doctor of Divinity in 1913) and [[McCormick Theological Seminary]] (graduated 1888). Baird sailed to Korea to do missionary work, arriving in 1891, less than two months after marrying Annie Adams (December 18, 1890). His first missionizing was in [[Busan]] in September of the same year.<ref name="Ja-young 2021, p. 20">Yi Ja-young, "Founder of SSU, William M. Baird," ''The Soongsil Times XXIX (137):2021, p. 20</ref>
Beginning with a "Sarangbang" class in [[Pyeongyang]] in 1897, Baird's efforts grew into the Soongsil School in 1900 and eventually into an institution of higher education, graduating its first students in 1908.<ref>Yi Ja-young, "Founder of SSU, William M. Baird," ''The Soongsil Times XXIX (137):2021, p. 21</ref> He died in 1931. Baird Hall on the Soongsil campus is named after him, and there is a bronze bust of him there as well.<ref name="Ja-young 2021, p. 20"/> <!-- DIED 1937? -->
==Archival collections==
The [[Presbyterian Historical Society]] in [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]] has a collection of Dr. William Baird's [http://www.history.pcusa.org/collections/findingaids/fa.cfm?record_id=173 diaries and correspondence] that document, among other events, his early years as a missionary in [[Korea]] and the death of his first wife, Annie Laurie Baird, in 1916.
The Society also holds a collection of the [http://www.history.pcusa.org/collections/findingaids/fa.cfm?record_id=316 Baird Family papers], which consists of correspondence and photographs of Dr. Baird, his brother Richard, and his wife Anna.
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}

{{Use British English|date=September 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox recurring event | name = Women of the World Festival | native_name = | native_name_lang = | logo = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | logo_size = | image = Women_Of_the_World_festival_logo.png | image_size = | alt = | caption = | status = <!-- e.g. defunct, active, inactive ... --> | genre = <!-- e.g. natural phenomena, fairs, festivals, conferences, exhibitions ... --> | date = <!-- {{start date|YYYY|mm|dd}} "dates=" also works, but do not use both --> | begins = <!-- {{start date|YYYY|mm|dd}} --> | ends = <!-- {{start date|YYYY|mm|dd}} --> | frequency = <!-- Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, Semi-annually, Annually, Bi-annually, 2nd Tuesday of November, etc. --> | venue = [[South Bank Centre]], London | location = | coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LON|type:event|display=inline,title}} --> | country = | years_active = <!-- {{age|YYYY|mm|dd}} Date of the first occurrence --> | founded = {{start date|df=yes|2010|03|08}} | founder_name = [[Jude Kelly]] | last = | prev = | next = | participants = | attendance = | capacity = | area = | budget = | activity = Celebrates the achievements of women and girls as well as looking at the obstacles they face across the world | leader_name = | patron = [[Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall]] (president) | organised = <!-- "organized=" also works --> | filing = | people = | member = | sponsor = | website = {{URL|www.thewowfoundation.com}} | footnotes = }} '''Women of the World Festival''' ('''WOW''') is a UK-based festival that celebrates the achievements of women and girls, as well as looking at the obstacles they face across the world. It seeks to inspire new generations of young women and girls.
The festival was founded in 2010 by [[Jude Kelly]]<ref name="guardian-aitkenhead">{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2018/jan/26/southbank-director-jude-kelly-saying-youre-a-feminist-is-not-enough | date = 26 January 2018 | accessdate = 27 January 2018 | first = Decca | last = Aitkenhead | authorlink = Decca Aitkenhead | newspaper = [[The Guardian]] | location = London | title = Southbank director Jude Kelly: ‘Saying you’re a feminist is not enough’}}</ref><ref name="guardian-brown">{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2018/jan/18/southbank-centre-artistic-director-jude-kelly-to-step-down | date = 18 January 2018 | accessdate = 27 January 2018 | first = Mark | last = Brown | newspaper = The Guardian | location = London | title = Southbank Centre artistic director Jude Kelly to step down}}</ref> and contains arts and science programmes. It takes place in early March around [[International Women's Day]]. WOW sponsors lectures, debates and performance on a range of themes and topics. Its principal venue is the [[Southbank Centre]] in London, where it was founded. There are satellite venues at other locations, notably [[Cambridge, UK]], [[Hong Kong]], [[Ethiopia]], [[Australia]], [[Iceland]], [[New York City|New York]], and [[Egypt]].<ref>[http://www.cam.ac.uk/women-at-cambridge/events/shape-the-wow-cambridge-festival WOW-Cambridge Festival] WoW Cambridge 2014.</ref><ref>[http://www.wowcambridge.cam.ac.uk/ WOW Women of the World Cambridge]. Retrieved March 2015.</ref><ref>[http://wow.southbankcentre.co.uk/page/whats-wow-all-about-founder-jude-kelly-explains-956 "What’s WOW all about? Founder Jude Kelly explains"]. South Bank Centre website. Retrieved March 2015.</ref>
Since 2015 [[Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall]], has been WOW's president.<ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/camilla-to-be-president-of-women-of-the-world-festival-10049309.html|title = Camilla to be president of Women of the World festival|last = Jobson |first = Robert|date = 16 February 2015|work = London Evening Standard|access-date =}} Retrieved March 2015.</ref> Also in 2015 the [[BBC]] streamed much of its content.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/articles/3vsFBxBL3Ky72j4BsVKH8Sb/wow-women-of-the-world-festival WOW - Women of the World Festival], ''[[Woman's Hour]]'', [[BBC Radio 4]], March 2015.</ref>
The Southbank Centre has been listed in ''The Times'' Top 50 employers for women.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://gender.bitc.org.uk/awards-benchmarking/2016genderequalityawards|title=Workplace Gender Equality Awards 2016|website=Gender|access-date=13 March 2016}}</ref> Its Women of the World festival has been nominated for two awards as part of the Business in the Community Workplace Gender Equality Awards 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bitc.org.uk/awards|title=Awards & recognition|website=Business in the Community|access-date=13 March 2016}}</ref>
== Description == Women of the World is a week-long festival held in various places around the world. It features musical performances, debates, public speeches, mentoring sessions, and more. Women of the World festival is usually referred to as WOW.
The first WOW Festival was held in the United Kingdom, but now takes place in many other locations throughout the world. The festivals are rooted in local areas, but are connected internationally. The festivals feed into each other, sharing stories and inspiring one another. All of the festivals are intertwined but each is unique in its own way. They all share the same WOW name. To date the Women of the World Festival has been held across three different continents. By 2018, WOW will take place in 53 countries.
==See also== * [[Being a Man Festival]]
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== * {{Official website|www.thewowfoundation.com}}
